Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery little master cup; interior glazed black; exterior: from top, part of black band above reserved handle zone with plastic hand; thumbnail coloured black; black band below handle zone.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to the South Ionian little master cup Type and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. For parallels regarding the decoration, see British Museum 1888,0601.606. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 113, Nau 72, pl. 15j)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.757) (Phase 3)
